revised_title: Evolution and Structure of Glycolytic Enzymes
tldr: The article examines the evolution of glycolytic enzymes and their structure, focusing on the role of domains in their development. It discusses the common domains found in glycolytic enzymes, such as the NAD-binding domain in dehydrogenases, and how these domains may have evolved from simpler structures. The article also highlights the importance of understanding enzyme evolution in the context of other essential metabolic processes in early biological developments.
